content:
Here's a mockup of some new inputs/buttons that would likely be used for the /login, /register, and alike pages in the portico set. What do you think?

Interaction GIF

This covers :focus, :valid, :invalid, and :hover states.
There's also a state not shown here in the signup that is :active where it turns the bg a very very faint shade of green to indicate you are currently mousedown on it.

I feel like the Sign Up could be more prominent (e.g. colored background?), but also happy to wait to see how it looks on the page.
Should the placeholder be left-justified?
I like the Username moving up into the upper left corner, and the validation checkmark. (Though probably we should validate only after they lose focus? Since in some cases we'll want to display an error message as well.)

Woah, looks brilliant!

Maybe in the sign up button, when it's hovered I'd make the background color the same as in the borders, and put the text in white.

About what Rishi says, an option could be displaying the full error message when the text input is unfocused, or after X milliseconds without getting new input.
Yeah, I guess would any error messages be displayed below the widget?
